docs.snippet: President Donald Trump's strategy for the U.S.-Mexico border includes mobilizing the National Guard, the White House said on Tuesday, after Trump had earlier spoken publicly to reporters about "guarding our border with the military" to stop illega...

headline.main: National Guard Part of Trump's Mexico Border Strategy: White House
headline.print_headline: National Guard Part of Trump's Mexico Border Strategy: White House

docs.snippet: Former Veterans Affairs Secretary David Shulkin downplayed concerns about his potential successor's lack of managerial experience Monday, saying the key for improving the VA will be surrounding White House doctor Ronny Jackson with a good team "be...

headline.main: Shulkin Says He Has 'Comfort' With Potential Successor at VA
headline.print_headline: Shulkin Says He Has 'Comfort' With Potential Successor at VA

docs.snippet: Turkey on Saturday criticized the United States over sending what it said were mixed messages on Syria, saying Washington was sowing confusion by equivocating about its future role in the country.

headline.main: Turkey Criticizes United States Over Mixed Messages on Syria
headline.print_headline: Turkey Criticizes United States Over Mixed Messages on Syria

docs.snippet: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency administrator Scott Pruitt held 25-times more meetings with industry representatives than environmental advocates during his first seven months in office, according to a Reuters analysis of his schedule, reflec...

headline.main: Embattled EPA Chief's Calendar Shows Industry Had His Ear
headline.print_headline: Embattled EPA Chief's Calendar Shows Industry Had His Ear

docs.snippet: The U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) is looking to find ways to shield farmers from the growing trade conflict between the United States and China, a department official said Thursday evening, without providing details of options under review...

headline.main: USDA Looking for Ways to Protect Farmers in China Trade Dispute: USDA Official
headline.print_headline: USDA Looking for Ways to Protect Farmers in China Trade Dispute: USDA Official

docs.snippet: U.S. Senator Chuck Grassley on Wednesday blasted the Trump administration over its handling of trade issues, saying while the United States should act, China's retaliatory moves were disproportionately affecting America's agriculture sector.

headline.main: U.S. Must 'Mitigate' Trade Damage on American Farmers: Senator
headline.print_headline: U.S. Must 'Mitigate' Trade Damage on American Farmers: Senator

docs.snippet: Ford Motor Co on Wednesday said it encouraged the U.S. and Chinese governments to "work together to resolve issues" after China retaliated against U.S. plans to impose tariffs with a list of similar duties.

headline.main: Ford Motor Urges U.S., China to Resolve Trade Issues
headline.print_headline: Ford Motor Urges U.S., China to Resolve Trade Issues

docs.snippet: The U.S. House Ways and Means Committee will hold a hearing on the effects of recent tariff increases on April 12, its chairman said on Thursday.

headline.main: U.S. House Ways and Means Committee to Hold Tariff Hearing April 12
headline.print_headline: U.S. House Ways and Means Committee to Hold Tariff Hearing April 12

docs.snippet: A survivor of the Parkland, Florida, school shooting joined the Rev. Al Sharpton on Saturday to announce a June rally in front of President Donald Trump's Manhattan apartment to protest gun violence eased by access to assault weapons.

headline.main: Sharpton, School Survivor, Announce Anti-Gun Violence Rally
headline.print_headline: Sharpton, School Survivor, Announce Anti-Gun Violence Rally
